contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = You See Colours | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Delays]] | Cover = You See colours.jpg | Released = 6 March 2006 | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = 40:09 | Label = [[Rough Trade Records]] | Producer = [[Graham_Sutton_(musician)|Graham Sutton]] | Last album = ''[[Faded Seaside Glamour]]'' <br /> (2004) | This album = ''You See Colours'' <br /> (2006) | Next album = ''[[Everything's the Rush]]'' <br /> (2008)|}} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r833634|first=Sharon|last=Mawer}}</ref> | rev2 = ''[[MusicOMH]]'' | rev2Score = {{Rating|4|5}} <ref>[http://www.musicomh.com/albums/delays-2_0306.htm ''MusicOHM'' review]</ref> | rev3 = ''[[Stylus Magazine|Stylus]]'' | rev3Score = (B) <ref>[http://www.stylusmagazine.com/review.php?ID=3861 ''Stylus'' review]</ref> }} '''You See Colours''' is the second album by [[United Kingdom|British]] band [[Delays]]. It was produced and mixed by their long-time collaborator [[Graham_Sutton_(musician)|Graham Sutton]] and was released on 6 March 2006. The lead single was "[[Valentine (Delays song)|Valentine]]", on which the band were assisted by [[Trevor Horn]]. A second single, "Hideaway", was also released. ==Track listing== All tracks by G.Gilbert/A.Gilbert, except where noted. #"You and Me" - 4:43 #"[[Valentine (Delays song)|Valentine]]" - 4:52 #"This Town's Religion" (G.Gilbert) - 3:08 #"Sink Like a Stone" (G.Gilbert) - 3:05 #"Too Much in Your Life" - 4:39 #"Winter's Memory of Summer" - 3:10 #"Given Time" (G.Gilbert) - 3:00 #"[[Hideaway (Delays song)|Hideaway]]" (G.Gilbert) - 3:48 #"Lillian" - 3:01 #"Out of Nowhere" (G.Gilbert) - 2:46 #"Waste of Space" - 3:57 ==References== {{Reflist}} <br /> {{Delays}} [[Category:Delays albums]] [[Category:2006 albums]]
